entry.title: The Social Security Pensions (Low Earnings Threshold) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order, which corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2015/186) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under section 148A of the Social Security Administration Act 1992, directs that the low earnings threshold for the purposes of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 for the tax years following 2014-2015 shall be £15,300. The low earnings threshold is used for the purposes of calculating entitlement to the additional pension (the state second pension) in a state retirement pension.

entry.title: The Guaranteed Minimum Pensions Increase Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Guaranteed Minimum Pensions Increase Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order specifies 1.2 per cent. as the percentage by which that part of any guaranteed minimum pension attributable to earnings factors for the tax years 1988-89 to 1996-97 and payable by contracted-out, defined benefit occupational pension schemes is to be increased. Under section 109(3) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (c.48) the percentage to be specified is the actual percentage increase in the general level of prices in the period under review or 3 per cent., whichever is less.

entry.title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating (Northern Ireland) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating (Northern Ireland) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order is made by the Treasury following a review of the general level of prices conducted under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c. 5) in the tax year ending 5th April 2015.

entry.title: The Infrastructure Act 2015 (Commencement No.1) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations are the first commencement regulations made under the Infrastructure Act 2015 (c.7) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Ecodesign for Energy-Related Products and Energy Information (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Ecodesign for Energy-Related Products Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/2617) (“the 2010 Regulations”) and the Energy Information Regulations 2011 (S.I. 2011/1524) (“the 2011 Regulations”) and partially implement Commission Regulations (EU) Nos 548/2014 and 1253/2014, and Commission Delegated Regulations (EU) No 1254/2014 as follows—

entry.title: The Flexible Working Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for—

entry.title: The Automatic Enrolment (Earnings Trigger and Qualifying Earnings Band) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Automatic Enrolment (Earnings Trigger and Qualifying Earnings Band) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order makes provision under sections 14 and 15A of the Pensions Act 2008 (c. 30) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Representation of the People (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Representation of the People (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2015

category.term: REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend certain regulations in the Representation of the People (England and Wales) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/341) which relate to the new system of individual electoral registration.

entry.title: The Social Security Revaluation of Earnings Factors Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
The Temporary Exclusion Orders (Notices) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision under section 13(1) and (2) of the Counter-Terrorism and Security Act 2015 (“the 2015 Act”) in respect of the giving of notice to a person on whom the Secretary of State has decided to impose a temporary exclusion order under section 2 or obligations under section 9 of the 2015 Act. The Regulations make provision for the timing and method of giving notice, and in respect of circumstances in which notice is to be deemed to have been given.

entry.title: The Dorset and Wiltshire Fire and Rescue Authority (Combination Scheme) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes a scheme which combines the areas of the Dorset Fire Authority and the Wiltshire and Swindon Fire Authority into a combined fire and rescue area. The Scheme comes into force on 1st April 2015 for the purpose of doing anything which is necessary to bring the Scheme fully into operation on 1st April 2016. The Scheme establishes a fire and rescue authority for the combined area, to be known as the Dorset and Wiltshire Fire and Rescue Authority, and provides for the appointment and terms of office of its members, and for meetings of the Authority. The Scheme also provides for the transfer of staff, and certain property, rights and liabilities, directly from the existing authorities to the new combined authority.

entry.title: The Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (Application of Parts 12ZA and 12ZB to Adoptions from Overseas) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (Application of Parts 12ZA and 12ZB to Adoptions from Overseas) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003. The amendments made by these Regulations apply Part 12ZC (Statutory Shared Parental Pay) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992, as modified by these Regulations, to adoptions from overseas, which are adoptions of children who enter Northern Ireland from outside the United Kingdom in connection with, or for the purposes of, adoption which does not involve the placement of a child for adoption under the law of any part of the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Statutory Adoption Pay (Curtailment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations allow eligible adopters to curtail their adoption pay period in accordance with section 167ZN(2A) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”) in order to enable them to take statutory shared parental pay in accordance with section 167ZW and 167ZX of that Act. The Regulations also allow eligible adopters to curtail their adoption pay period in accordance with 167ZN(2A) of the 1992 Act in order to allow their partner to take statutory shared parental pay in accordance with sections 167ZW and 167ZX of that Act, or shared parental leave in accordance with article 6 of the Employment Rights (Northern Ireland) Order 1996.

entry.title: The Companies Act 2006 (Amendment of Part 18) Regulations 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Companies Act 2006 (Amendment of Part 18) Regulations 2015

entry.summary: These Regulations come into force on 6th April 2015 and extend to the whole of the United Kingdom, reflecting the extent of the Companies Act 2006 (c.46).

entry.title: The Statutory Shared Parental Pay (Parental Order Cases) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations provide an entitlement to statutory shared parental pay in respect of cases which involve a person who has applied with another person for a parental order under section 54 of the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 2008. Under that section a court may make an order providing for a child of a surrogate mother to be treated as the child of the applicants for the order if certain conditions are satisfied.

entry.title: The Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (Application of Parts 12ZA, 12ZB and 12ZC to Parental Order Cases) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations apply Parts 12ZA, 12ZB and 12ZC of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992, as modified by these Regulations, to parental order parents. A parental order parent is a person who has applied, or intends to apply, with another person, under section 54 of the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 2008 for a parental order in respect of a child or someone who has such an order. Part 12ZA provides for entitlement to statutory paternity pay. Part 12ZB provides for entitlement to statutory adoption pay. Part 12ZC provides for entitlement statutory shared parental pay.

entry.title: The Shared Parental Leave and Paternity and Adoption Leave (Adoptions from Overseas) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to shared parental leave in respect of adoptions from overseas. An adoption from overseas is defined in the Regulations as an adoption of a child who enters Northern Ireland from outside the United Kingdom in connection with or for the purposes of an adoption which does not involve the placement of the child for adoption under the law of any part of the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Maternity and Adoption Leave (Curtailment of Statutory Rights to Leave) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations allow women entitled to ordinary maternity leave under Article 103 of the Employment Rights (Northern Ireland) Order 1996 and additional maternity leave under Article 105 of that Order (“statutory maternity leave”) to curtail that leave to enable them or their spouse, civil partner or partner (“partner”) to take shared parental leave provided for by Article 107E of the Employment Rights (Northern Ireland) Order 1996. They also allow persons who are entitled to ordinary adoption leave under Article 107A and additional adoption leave under Article 107B (“statutory adoption leave”) to curtail that leave to enable them or their partner to take shared parental leave provided for by Article 107G of that Order. The right to curtail statutory adoption leave extends to foster parents who, in accordance with established processes, have been identified as the prospective adopters of a particular child.

entry.title: The European Parliamentary Elections (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make consequential changes to the European Parliamentary Elections Regulations 2004 arising out of provisions in the Electoral Registration and Administration Act 2013, amending provisions which relate to the date relevant to assessing certain grounds for exclusion from voting (regulation 3) and requiring proxies at a European Parliamentary election in Great Britain to be entitled to vote at that election (regulation 4).

entry.title: The Tax Credits (Appeals) Regulations (Northern Ireland) (Amendment) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Tax Credits (Appeals) Regulations (Northern Ireland) (Amendment) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order amends the Tax Credits (Appeals) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002 (S.R. (NI) 2002 No 403) (“the Regulations”) with effect from the day after the day on which it is made.
